Using Topics

The Topic component enables organizations to create threaded conversations that can be placed in specific project folders and linked to specific items. Team members can raise and discuss issues about a project, specific files, defects, and so on.

The historical value of these comments is significant to the project because future team members working on the project can:

  • Get up to date quickly by reading the topics that are important to them.

  • Avoid retrying solutions that were previously found faulty.

  • Understand why a particular solution to a problem was chosen.

In threaded messaging, the initial message in each topic becomes the root of a tree, while responses to that topic become branches of the tree. Responses to the responses form additional branches. Thus, all messages on the topic are kept together and the order and relationship of the responses can be easily seen.

Any type of threaded messaging improves teamwork on product development. However, because the application has tightly integrated components, it enables team members to:

  • Link topics directly to folders or other items, such as change requests.

  • Ask questions and quickly receive input while working on a file.

  • Attach notes to a topic explaining why a particular method was used.

  • Point out aspects of the project that may need to change in a later release.
